meta.title: Green and Blue Mountain Trail - Elgin, Western Cape
meta.description: Hike through fynbos, private reserves, wine and fruit farms, overnighting in 4-star country houses with fine Cape wine and dining. Just 1 hr drive from Cape Town.

frontmatter.tourName: The Green and Blue Mountain Trail – Elgin
longDescription: The Green and Blue Mountain Trails are four and three - day hikes along the Groenlandberg and Elgin valley - Houw Hoek, Western Cape. Approximately 1hr’s drive from Cape Town. The trail's traverse a tapestry of fynbos, private nature reserves, wine and fruit farms - offering four-star country lodging, fine Cape cuisine and enriched guiding.

Daily hike distances range between 11 - 18 km/day, with every day offering a varied terrain and experience.  From picnic lunches at Oak Valley to poplar forest explorations, fynbos on the Houwhoek mountains, or a refreshing dip in a stream along the way. A slack packing trail in this neck of the woods, would not be complete without a few wine tastings along the way. Here Porcupine Hills, Paul Cluver and Beaumont wines come to taste.

details.heading: Trip Duration
description: Green Mountain: 4 Night/ 4 Day Trail
Blue Mountain: 3 Night/ 3 Day Trail

details.heading: Daily Distances
description: Day 1: 18km    Day 2: 15km
Day 3: 13 km   Day 4: 11km

details.heading: Trail Grading
description: 3/ 5 - Fitness. Moderate to good hiking fitness recommended.
2/ 5 - Technicality. Mostly good clear trail. Some long’ish ascents. Rocky in parts.

details.heading: Trail Terrain
description: Mountain paths, ravine trails and wine and fruit farm traverses.

details.heading: Accommodation
description: 4-star equivalent Country Houses and Lodges.

details.heading: Logistic Support
description: Professionally guided, fully supported slack packing trail with exclusive extras - wine tastings
Luggage transfers and return transfers to start of trail

details.heading: Group Size
description: Scheduled from a Monday to a Friday, with a min group size of 7 - max 10 persons/ trip

details.heading: Pricing
description: From R8,950/pp/sharing for the 3 day/3 night trail

frontmatter.emailSubject: Green & Blue Mountain Hike Enquiry – PP Enquire Now

overview.heading: At a Glance
description: The Green Mountain trail (4 days/ 4 nights) scheduled from a Monday to Friday, traverses mostly privately-owned land, with all landowners being members of the Groenlandberg Conservancy: the world’s first biodiversity wine route, and part of the region’s efforts to conserve the environment and promote responsible tourism.

The Blue Mountain Trail, which runs from a Tuesday to a Thursday, is a three day - three night slackpacking trail on the southern side of the Elgin Valley. The trail is 50 km in total, traversing forest, wilderness, fynbos and fruit farms.

As part of the trail’s social responsibility programme, hikers are encouraged to “Walk with an Alien”, a project in which a personalised walking stick is carved from alien vegetation by local communities.

itinerary.heading: Green Mountain Day 1
itinerary.subHeading: Arrival Day: Arrive at Porcupine Hills (near Houw Hoek)  between 16h00-17h30
description: Local Wine tasting & dinner
Overnight: Porcupine Hills (Dinner provided)

itinerary.heading: Day 2
itinerary.subHeading: Hike Day 1: Walking in the Kogelberg Conservancy Core (18km / 6 hrs)
description: Breakfast at Porcupine Hills. Transfer to Kogelberg Biosphere fringe by tractor. Steady walk to the top of Groenlandberg, through the Biosphere Core to Nuweberg. Picnic lunch enjoyed on the mountain. Return transfer to Porcupine Hills to overnight.
Overnight: Porcupine Hills (breakfast, picnic lunch & dinner)

itinerary.heading: Day 3
itinerary.subHeading: Hike Day 2: Hike through Fynbos and Vines (15km / 5hrs)
description: Transfer to Nuweberg and bags transferred to Wildekrans. Walk through the vineyards and fynbos along the foot of the Groenlandberg. Picnic lunch on Oak Valley Estate. Continue on to Paul Cluver Wine Estate with wine tasting & afternoon tea. Transfer provided to Wildekrans Country House, Houw Hoek Village.
Overnight: Wildekrans Country House (breakfast, picnic lunch & dinner)

itinerary.heading: Day 4
description: Breakfast at Wildekrans. Transfer to Paul Cluver Estate - where the walk embarks through poplar forest. Walk through the failed MTO forest and into the fynbos of the Houw Hoek mountains.
Lunch under the trees at Wildekrans Country House. Afternoon at leisure.
Overnight: Wildekrans Country House (breakfast, picnic lunch & dinner)

itinerary.heading: Day 5
itinerary.subHeading: Hike Day 4: Leopard and Ox Wagon Route (11km / 4- 5hrs)
description: Breakfast at Wildekrans. Head towards Bot River through the Biosphere fynbos. Rest stop at Stony Beach and ledge rock. Climb up Pincushion ridge and discover Haws ton lookout.
Descend into Bot River and Beaumont Wines. Lunch in Bot River village.
Transfer back to Porcupine Hills to collect your vehicle. Porcupine Hills has an open air shower with views over the olive grove where you can refresh before departure.

images.heading: Looking onto the Groenlandberg from Wildekrans Guest house

lodging.heading: Lodges
description: 4-star equivalent Country Houses and Lodges (all ensuite).
Bedding and towels provided
Cuisine with Cape flair and finesse
Private Wine Tastings & Picnic spreads
Art & Garden Sculptures by prominent local artists

faq.question: Can children join this hike?
answer: Yes, accompanied by an adult and being sufficiently fit for the durations.

faq.question: Are we a private group if we not a group of 10 persons?
answer: No. We will 'schedule' the trip and add others to it up to maximum of 10 hikers/ per trip. If you want exclsuivity, please try to arrnage a group of 10 persons.

faq.question: Do you cater for vegans?
answer: Yes, we cater to all diets and have delicious dishes lined up for all walkers.

faq.question: Can I bring my dog along?
answer: No, unfortunately not, we walk in protected natural and remote areas where domestic animals are not permitted.

faq.question: Which is your closest airport and how far from you?
Do you recommend a transfer company or should we rent a car?
answer: We recommend Overberg Transfers who will collect and drop you avoiding the hassle of renting your own car.

faq.question: Do you walk all year round?
answer: Yes, we do. We tend not to walk in the month of July, unless it is the only time a group can get away.

pictures.caption: Fire is essential to the proteaceae regeneration cycle.
From garden to plate: meals are organic, local and delicious.
A duckling rescue in operation.
Many beautiful species of Iradaceae emerge in Spring.
Pinks and blues, and everything in-between, when you look a little closer.
And of course the multi-coloured pins – so popular in the cut flower market.
The founder of the Green Mountain trail, Alison Green, on the final day of the trail.
Stone sculptures and a natural pool at Wildekrans Guesthouse – night 3 and 4 of the Green Mountain hiking trail.
Prominent artists have their sculptures on display around the gardens of Wildekrans.
Passionate guiding on Day 4 of the Green Mountain trail, with the old Houw Hoek railway line in the background.
The jagged rocks at Haws ton lookout.
Finishing the hike off the at the lovely Beaumont winery with a Ploughmans platter and wine tasting.

price.heading: Green Mountain: 4 Night/ 4 Day Trail: R12 490/pp
includes: 4/3 Nights Accom in 4 Star Country Houses
All meals - from dinner on arrival night to lunch on departure day
All private wine tastings, teas and snacks
Daily transfers as per itinerary and return to vehicles (start)
A ‘Walk with an Alien’ Walking Stick
